column3: The Palace Theatre has been wonderfully renovated over the years and still keeps signage from the 1920s up to lead visitors to the restrooms or exits. Take an Uber or Lyft to avoid the hassle and cost of parking. I hope we get to visit the theatre again someday.

column2: One of the oldest theatres in LA
column3: It has a gorgeous fa√ßade and the design embellishment and beauty continues within. It opened in 1911, making it one of the oldest theatres in LA.It was the third home of the Orpheum Circuit and in its early days stars such as Harry Houdini and Fred Astaire graced its stage.Nowadays it can be booked for events and it also serves as a movie location.
